parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I make narrow (strictly: by pressure); I press upon, (b) I persecute, press hard. Akin to the base of tribos; to crowd.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From the same as stenochoria; to hem in closely, i.e. cramp.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From a compound of a and the base of poreuomai; to have no way out, i.e. Be at a loss.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To be utterly without resource, be in despair. Middle voice from ek and aporeo; to be utterly at a loss, i.e. Despond.
